title: Capacitor-Q on cylindrical cap at 20 V-kappa is 4

content.question: An isolated, cylindrical capacitor has plates in the shape of two concentric cylinders, as shown in the figure. The gap between the plates is filled with a material that has a dielectric constant of <math alttext="4.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn></math>. The cylindrical plates are close enough in size that the capacitor can be treated as a parallel-plate capacitor, where the plates each have an area of <math alttext="0.020 meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and there is a gap of <math alttext="0.0010 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0010</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> between them. When the potential difference across the plates is <math alttext="20 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>, what is the magnitude of the charge on each plate?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
